alert.note: Alert for Iowa; Keokuk (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 16 at 2:33PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Keokuk and southwestern Iowa Counties through 315 PM CDT... At 233 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Keswick to near What Cheer. Movement was southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could cause minor tree limb damage and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... What Cheer and Keswick around 240 PM CDT. Delta and South English around 245 PM CDT. Sigourney around 250 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Webster, Yenruogis County Park, Thornburg, Keokuk County Fairgrounds, Coal Creek, Gibson, Keokuk County Expo, Lake Belva Deer Park, and Keota. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
